intro: Gomphostemma microdon, commonly known as the small-flowered gomphostemma, is a climbing vine native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release small, winged seeds. Gomphostemma microdon is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
